text: ghost hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
the new Ghost LP in infest assume ghost
or ghost BC is a Swedish traditional
doom metal slash heavy metal slash hard
rock outfit and this is their highly
anticipated sophomore LP very
anticipated by me and much of the metal
community since the hype died down from
their very very popular full-length
debut opus eponymous for the most part
the band plays this old-school style of
heavy metal that has a strong strong
occult vibe Blue Oyster Cult and Black
Sabbath influences aside opus eponymous
had some characteristics that made it a
pretty odd modern metal release the
album is incredibly hooky and in melodic
and not in a very technical way or a way
that is alienating to your average music
listener their course is all over this
album that just buried themselves deep
within the brain songs like ritual as
well as Eliza Beth and in comparison
with other frontmen out there these days
ghosts vocalists is really one of the
most agreeable metal singers out there
not really having anything too sharp or
abrasive or just aggressive about the
way that he sings his voice is
incredibly friendly at times kind of
smooth if there's anything that's sour
about it can at times be eerie the only
thing that is overtly off-putting about
ghosts music are these strong dark and
and satanic messages that come through
in the lyrics and they display these
things in a really theatrical way not
quite as torturous as some bands that
seem to take these themes a bit more
seriously despite all of these issues
this album took the metal world by storm
however I have to admit I'm not really
enjoying the sophomore full length as
much it is very clear that ghost shoots
for some really ambitious changes on
this new LP but not all of them add a
prose for the most part it's it's a lot
of cons for one this record was recorded
in a new studio on a new record label
with a brand new budget and it
definitely shows and shows up in ways
that on paper would seem like a really
good thing like for one there's all
these huge monstrous gothic choruses
that pop up occasionally on these tracks
bringing this huge sense of epicness the
songs overall on this LP are longer
there are more guitar solos some more
instrumental passages more movements to
the songs more layers of guitar more
layers of background vocals synthesizers
come through in a big way on a lot of
these tracks on this LP no question
ghost is sounding thicker they're
sounding more detailed they're sounding
more fleshed out but all of these
additions have created some really
glaring issues in my eyes it's sort of
distracted ghost away from songwriting
and hooks which was the best thing opus
eponymous had going for it and instead
they're turning their eyes toward things
that aren't necessarily their strengths
like pulling together these sort of epic
instrumental moments which has never
really been one of the best qualities of
the band mostly due to how stiff some of
the guitar playing can be on their
records as a fan of opus eponymous I can
admittedly say that the four minute
closing instrumental on the album is
really one of the weakest points on the
entire LP so I'm a lot of these tracks
the band is showcasing this instrumental
and compositional power that they don't
particularly have and on top of that all
of these added about bells and whistles
and sounds and and choral vocals they
all add to this sense of hokey Nastase
they were close to being maybe a little
over the edge with it but like I said
earlier the songwriting and just that
strong eerie vibe that they had made up
for it certainly there are spots on this
LP where ghost is able to take these
choral vocals this newfound detail these
longer song lengths and pull them
together with a really good tune the
song Body and Blood sticks out to me as
a song like that it's a very very eerie
ballad lots of guitar leads interjecting
between chorus lines on this track
it's just so freakin dark and cultish
and successfully blends the sound that
you typically expect from ghosts with
some ideas that feel sort of psych rock
inspired and progressive rock inspired
however it's really the song Year Zero
that I think is able to maintain the
most focus with all of these new
additions it's a great song that gallops
away valiantly with this monstrous
gothic chorus right at the start of the
song great verses great choruses a
really fantastic guitar solo toward the
end of the track with some tubular bells
chiming away epically it's a huge ending
with a really dreary outro right on the
tail end of the track it's just a full
package deal these awesome choral vocals
also show up on the very melodic closing
track on this album another favorite on
the LP for me to me these are just
highlights on the album some of my
favorite moments and and really tracks
that I'm happier there because it gives
me at least some level of faith that the
next album will be better and maybe
whatever issues I have with this LP will
kind of be smoothed out by them it songs
like idolatry which really kind of get
me cringing the song is just littered
with these inexplicably
wimpy guitar riffs and schmaltzy organs
and I can't really put my finger on it
because the vocals sound roughly the
same as they do on other tracks here but
on this particular song I just feel like
I'm listening to some really bad bark of
herb and the vocals just don't really
have that eerie vibe on this song that
they do on others they just sound kind
of silly on this track the song just
kind of sounds like this really old bad
psych pop single that would have never
ever ever seen the light of day if it
had been written in the 60s for me this
track really sort of steps over a line
and I just can't believe that the band
didn't see it especially with the
terrible falsetto is all over this song
and they sound even worse when they're
harmonized one of the lead singles off
of this LP secular haze also crosses
this line for sounding like it was
conceived underneath the circus tent
these same obnoxious scents dampen a
perfectly good vibe on the song per
aspera the song Kiki gollu is another
track that just sounds like really
had heavy psychedelic rock that would
have been better if the instruments were
actually played with any guts but there
none because they're not and there's not
really a particularly interesting song
on this track just sort of a guitar riff
that's supposed to have some momentum
maybe it just falls flat and feels hokey
and I have to say I was pretty
disappointed for the most part with the
longest track on this LP gulen zombie
queen sure it's ambitious the man is
trying to write a longer song something
that's gonna feel epic but the slow
melodic intro without that strong
compositional power there the moment at
which the song starts just feels kind of
boring and when the band finally kicks
in and starts bringing some power to the
song the drums pop in the guitars pop in
synthesizers pop in baby it just sounds
like a really bad surf pop tune blending
surf with metal is something that I've
heard before in bands like ghoul for
example but even they maintain some
level of badassness as they're doing it
whereas ghost just sounds ridiculous
the huge climax at the end of this track
is really the songs only redeeming value
for me overall I was just not feeling
this LP was really really sort of let
down by it
I feel like ghosts really let their
budget and let their ambition blind them
from just writing good Tunes for sure
all these additional elements could have
been added to the recipe to make it
fantastic it happens on this album with
songs like Year Zero but rarely do the
stars all aligned in this way on these
songs there are moments where just all
these additional things block the song
from even shining through and there are
moments where ghost is really sort of
trying to put forward a hard rock and
psychedelic rock influenced riff that
just doesn't have any real balls on it
overall I'm feeling a strong four to a
light five on this album if you've given
the listen what did you think of it did
you like this album did you hate it why
here's another opinion
don't listen to this guy over here I
listened to this album the vocals
wrecked the guitars wrecked the big
voices wrecked in the key Birds rats
Anthony Fantan Oh ghost forever
[Music]
